summary: The 'Fixing Exemptions for Networks Choosing to Enable Illegal Migration Act' (FENCE Act) amends the Internal Revenue Code to modify eligibility for 501(c)(3) status for organizations. It prohibits organizations from providing material support to individuals known or reasonably believed to be unlawfully present in the U.S. Religious organizations are protected from violating their beliefs or requiring immigration status verification. The bill's amendments are to take effect upon enactment.
